alert.note: Alert for Adams; Cumberland; Dauphin; Franklin; Lancaster; Lebanon; Perry; York (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 15 at 1:08PM EST until December 15 at 7:00PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Snow and sleet accumulations of an inch or two throughout the Susquehanna Valley with 3 to 4 inches on the ridges to the northwest of Interstate 81. Ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of central Pennsylvania. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The gradient in snow and sleet accumulation will increase from southeast to northwest across the warning area with maximum snow and sleet to the north of I- 81. Less than one inch of snow and sleet is expected to the south of US-30. A changeover to mainly rain is expected in most places south of Interstate 81 this afternoon though areas of freezing rain will likely continue.
info.instruction: The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission remind motorists to adjust speeds based on driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania roadways. Call 5 1 1 or visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway and traffic conditions. To report snow or ice, post to the NWS State College Facebook page, use Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or visit weather.gov/ctp.
